repnme.cdata!:
Albania - Second Poverty Reduction Support
            Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is satisfactory,
            sustainability highly likely, and the institutional
            development impact substantial. This Simplified
            Implementation Completion Report provides findings and
            implications for subsequent operations, and identifies three
            main lessons which can be drawn from the project. First, the
            number of policy reform areas addressed should be limited,
            particularly in an environment of political instability. The
            program for the series should be left more flexible, so as
            not to overburden the last of the series with an excessive
            unfinished agenda. A programmatic series with rotating focus
            from year to year, might better serve this purpose, than a
            series attempting to implement a large number of areas over
            a three-year period. Second, performance monitoring
            indicators should be limited to a core set of indicators
            which reflect what the program aims to achieve, and then
            closely monitored; yet, attention needs to be paid to
            setting up clear baselines from which to measure progress.
            Third, the presence of a strong country office, which
            continuously engages in the dialogue, and provides support
            for implementation, is critical to maintain momentum for
            such operations, as the experience of this project has
            clearly shown.

Albania - Second Poverty Reduction Support

5087076.trustfund:
TF051129-PHRD-ALBANIA: POVERTY REDUCTION
            SUPPORT CREDIT II
5087076.majtheme: Public sector governance,Human development,Social protection and risk management

repnme.cdata!:
Albania - Second Poverty Reduction Support
            Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Poverty Reduction Support Credit
            (PRSC) will develop, and implement fiscally sustainable
            policies within the framework of the Government's
            three-year National Strategy for Social and Economic
            Development (NSSED) supporting a higher quality of life
            (especially for the poor), and consistent with, and
            supportive of the country's overall growth strategy.
            This operation will support more effective, and efficient
            policy formulation, and implementation, improved access to
            social services, and better targeting of scarce fiscal
            resources to those most in need, and policies conducive to
            sustained growth. However, the primary risk remain the weak
            counterpart capacity to develop, and implement a
            comprehensive policy program. Nevertheless, main
            achievements under the project will outweigh those risks,
            mainly through the maintenance of satisfactory macroeconomic
            performance; implementation of a pension reform;
            strengthened capacity to monitor and evaluate the policy
            agenda, including institutional reforms; initiation on
            improved quality and access of priority education, and
            health services; and, improvement of the contestability of
            the policy formulation process, which includes strengthening
            accountability, and transparency of the public sector.
